Oh come on now Matt... if I didn't know you better, I'd accuse you of
trolling. :)

I can't begrudge you your overt cynnicism, but it's not QUITE that
bad-- it's not like we live in Texas.

It's part of the ebb and flow.  Right now we're seeing the neocon
evolution of the Republican-ruled "values" eras of the 50s and 80s...
and unfortunately, the absurdity of what comes out of the
neocon-figurehead-of-the-decade's mouth is far less polished than the
rhetoric of the past, but moderation will come.

I only hope against hope that we won't have to suffer social (60s) or
economic (early 90s) crisis to evolve past this No Talent Ass-Clown
that we call our Commander-in-Chief.  But, as the eastern philosophy
says: "This, too, shall pass."  And history has taught us that is will
have to get worse before it gets better.  The populace must have
causes to latchc on to and believe in before they participate in the
momentum swing.  We intellectuals just sit here playing armchair
politician, as always.  Anybody with such idealism is innately
unsuited for the part.

(Aside:  My brother's on his second tour of Iraq, and he's looking at
the possibility of anoth 15 months before he can return.  Not that he
minds, he's pretty gung-ho about the whole thing, as usual; I just
worry about what a snafu this whole thing has become and how it has
hurt our image in the worlds' eyes.)
